author: Aditi Ray
title: 10 Saree Colours That Look Great On Indian Skin Tones
text:
3, 2017 
While it’s absolutely important to keep your body type in mind while choosing a saree , you can’t deny the fact that colours play an equally important role when it comes to style. After all, you can’t expect to make an impression in a beautiful saree that doesn’t go with your skin tone at all. Indian skin tones range from light to dusky, and while it’s a blessing as you can pull off a number of shades, most Indian women aren’t aware of what works well for their skin tone. But fret not! Here are some awesome colours for Indian skin tones. 
1. Cobalt blue 
Many of you might shy away from this bold shade of blue, but you would be pleasantly surprised to know that it looks great on most Indian skin tones. This cobalt blue saree with a bright green border will make you stand out in the crowd. Best suited for light and wheatish skin tones. 
2. Emerald green 
Emerald is another colour that suits all Indian skin tones. Since it’s a jewel tone, it brightens up your look too. This emerald green saree is a classic that you can flaunt at evening parties as well as a brunch. 
3. Golden and grey 
Metallic grey and golden is a trend that’s taking the fashion scene by storm. This golden saree balanced with a grey border works well for all Indian skin tones. Perfect for a party, this unusual combination will get you all the attention. 
Shop for designer sarees . 
4. Magenta and orange 
Love a good colour play? You couldn’t find a more perfect saree than this gorgeous piece. A perfect combination of warm and cool colours, this magenta and orange saree will work well for light and medium skin tones. However, avoid wearing this bright piece during the day. 
5. Mustard yellow 
A great colour for dusky skin, this mustard kanjeevaram with a hint of maroon and golden zari work is a wonderful piece to own. The colour not only brightens up your look, but also lends you an air of elegance. Pair it with golden accessories for maximum impact. 
6. Earthy green 
A safe bet for all skin tones, you can trust this olive green saree to have your back in a moment of doubt. This earthy shade looks great on dusky beauties. The contrasting border subtly highlights the beauty of the saree. 
Shop for embroidered sarees . 
7. Magenta 
If you have a dusky complexion, don’t be afraid to pick colours that are closer to your skin tone. Dark shades like brown and magenta work well for you. Hence, this magenta saree with zari work will flatter your skin tone like no other. 
8. Maroon 
Maroon is a staple colour for every Indian woman, and for good reason. It’s a colour that suits every Indian skin tone – light or dark. And this lovely maroon saree is a great piece to wear for work as well as social dos. 
9. Black 
It’s not the go-to colour of every woman for nothing. For starters, the colour has a universal appeal and gives you plenty of room to experiment with your look. And this black saree with a red and golden border does just that. However, steer clear of dirty shades of black as they make your complexion appear ashen. Go with jet black or shimmering black instead. 
Shop for party wear sarees . 
10. Cream or off-white 
A colour for all Indian skin tones, cream is a popular choice. While women with light skin tones can carry it off extremely well, contrary to popular belief, the colour looks amazing on dusky women too. Throw in a bit of dark pink and you are set to look like a million bucks.
